result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernardo Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs of Count 5 shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision in Count 1 and Count 6.  Outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.  

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with the victim, her daughter, their family members or their residences.  

Defendant shall not possess any weapons.  

Defendant shall not associate with known drug users or dealers, or gang members.  

Defendant shall have no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall undergo a mental health evaluation and comply with counseling or treatment recommendations.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. 

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.  

Defendant shall use one pre-approved pharmacy to fill all prescriptions and provide the agent proof of all prescribed medications or any change of medication within 48 hours of the change.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Agent Karen Held also appears.  Victim appears.  Recess for defendant to review victim statement.  Reconvene.  Victim makes statements.  Statements by counsel.  Court enters judgment.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State agrees to read-in an uncharged incident from WCSD,15-39548 with DOV of 11-3-15 along with Count 2, Count 3, Count 4, Count 7 and Count 8 upon plea to Count 1, Count 5 and Count 6 and recommend a PSI with both sides free to argue.  No contest plea entered to Count 1, Count 5 and Guilty plea entered to Count 6.  Recess.  Reconvene.  Court dismissed Count 2, Count 3, Count 4, Count 7 and Count 8 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1, Count 5 and Count 6 and enters judgment.   Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Court revokes the bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust for State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.   State requests high cash bond; argument from defense, requests sig bond due to defendant being on probation hold;  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Court sets $20,000.00 cash bond;     Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
